content.question: Vectors <math alttext="vector A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> are drawn with the magnitudes and directions shown. Which of the following best represents the vector <math alttext="vector B minus vector A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>−</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows an arrow that points gradually upward and to the right.
The figure shows an arrow that points gradually upward and to the left.
The figure shows an arrow that points gradually downward and to the left.
The figure shows an arrow that points gradually downward and to the right.

content.answer: The figure shows an arrow that points gradually downward and to the right.
